name: Stones
description: Natural stones and megaliths that are places of strength and peace.

points.name: Uluru
points.description:
Uluru, also known as Ayers Rock is a large sandstone rock formation in the southern part of the Northern Territory in central Australia. It lies 335 km south west of the nearest large town, Alice Springs, 450 km by road. Uluru is sacred to the Pitjantjatjara Anangu, the Aboriginal people of the area. The area around the formation is home to an abundance of springs, waterholes, rock caves and ancient paintings.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artless
Wikipedia:Uluru
Custodian:www.leylines.net
Country:Australia

points.name: Externsteine
points.description:
The Externsteine is a distinctive sandstone rock formation located in the Teutoburg Forest, near the town of Horn-Bad Meinberg in the Lippe district of the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia. The formation is a tor consisting of several tall, narrow columns of rock which rise abruptly from the surrounding wooded hills.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artless
Wikipedia:Externsteine
Custodian:www.leylines.net
Country:Germany

points.name: Ingá Stone
points.description:
The Ingá Stone (Pedra do Ingá in Portuguese) is located in the middle of the Ingá River near the small city of Ingá, 96 km from João Pessoa, in Paraíba State in the northeast of Brazil. The Ingá Stone is also called Itacoatiara do Ingá. The word Ita means stone in the Tupi language of the natives that lived in that area. It is a rock formation in gneiss which covers an area of approximately 250 m². Altogether primary, a vertical wall 46 meters long by 3.8 meters high, and adjacent areas, there are entries whose meanings are unknown. Several figures are carved in low relief in this set, suggesting the representation of animals, fruits, and human constellations like Orion and Milky Way.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:Ingá Stone
Custodian:www.leylines.net
Country:Brazil

points.name: Gornaya Shoria megaliths
points.description:
The Gornaya Shoria megaliths (Mount Shoria megaliths) are rock formations that are part of Gornaya Shoria (Russian: Горная Шория) in southern Siberia, Russia, lying to the east of the Altay Mountains. Popular, often fringe, articles have claimed these rock formations to be gigantic prehistoric man-made blocks, or megaliths. It is reported that the largest pieces or blocks of stone have estimated weights between three and four thousand tons, which would make them larger than the megaliths at Baalbek, in Lebanon.
Type:Stone
Wikipedia:Gornaya Shoria megaliths
Custodian:www.leylines.net
Country:Russia

points.name: Masuda no Iwafune
points.description:
Masuda no Iwafune (Rock Ship of Masuda), near the top of Iwafune hill, is the largest carved stone object in the Asuka region. It is a huge boulder inferred to weigh 800 tons, with two square holes opened on the top. Clearly worked by human hands, it is not known who made it, when, or for what purpose.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:Masuda no Iwafune
Custodian:www.leylines.net
Country:Japan

points.name: Ishi no Hōden
points.description:
A mysterious dug-out cube monument in a quarry. Known as one of 3 greatest enigmas in Japan. Now worshiped as the god of the Ōshiko jinja shinto shrine. Although the structure of the top is concealed by pine trees, they suspect that there may be 2 holes like Masada-no-Iwafune and Kengoshizuka-kofun.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:Ishi no Hōden
Custodian:www.leylines.net
Country:Japan

points.name: Sigiriya
points.description:
Sigiriya (Lion Rock) is an ancient rock fortress located in the central Matale District near the town of Dambulla in the Central Province, Sri Lanka. The name refers to a site of historical and archaeological significance that is dominated by a massive column of rock nearly 200 metres (660 ft) high. According to the ancient Sri Lankan chronicle the Culavamsa, this site was selected by King Kasyapa (477 – 495 CE) for his new capital. He built his palace on the top of this rock and decorated its sides with colourful frescoes. On a small plateau about halfway up the side of this rock he built a gateway in the form of an enormous lion. The name of this place is derived from this structure —Sīhāgiri, the Lion Rock. The capital and the royal palace was abandoned after the king's death. It was used as a Buddhist monastery until the 14th century.
Type:Stone
Wikipedia:Sigiriya
Custodian:www.leylines.net
Country:Sri Lanka

points.name: São Thomé das Letras
points.description:
An enigmatic city where many UFOs are spotted. A hill where cars in neutral go up the hill, instead of down, a deep endless underground cave, and this face carved in a stone, called Witch Stone because it resembles a face of a witch, including her hat flap. Like the sphynx of Romania, there are several faces throughout the world.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:São Thomé das Letras
Custodian:Yasser Rabello (The Alchemist)
Country:Brazil

points.name: Parque Arqueológico do Solstício
points.description:
This Stonehenge may be a simple calendar, but in fact, it shows a lot more than we could imagine. Yasser Rabello realized that there are 3 stones with peculiar shapes: a human face, a dog, and a bull, representing respectively the constellations of Orion, Canis Majoris, and Taurus. Maybe this Amazon Stonehenge is not just a simple Sun calendar.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:Parque Arqueológico do Solstício
Custodian:Yasser Rabello (The Alchemist)
Country:Brazil

points.name: Pedra da Gávea
points.description:
Sitting atop a high mountain, this face appears to be an elongated head (like the Peruvian mummies, beings with elongated skulls). This monument is guarding an entrance to a cave (like many other faces, including the sphynx of Romania), where also enigmatic inscriptions were found.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artless
Wikipedia:Pedra da Gávea
Custodian:Yasser Rabello (The Alchemist)
Country:Brazil

points.name: Quixadá
points.description:
Quixadá is a Hotspot of UFOs. Not a surprise, since there is a Stone Zoo in this city. The picture here shows only 2 animals (a chicken and a turtle) but actually, there are over 20 other animals carved in massive monoliths in that same location. While some insist to say they are naturally formed by the erosion of rain and wind, statistics prove the opposite, since all of them are found in the same spot.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:Quixadá
Custodian:Yasser Rabello (The Alchemist)
Country:Brazil

points.name: Parque Natural Municipal Pedra do Segredo
points.description:
This stone was carved in a shape of a dead skull. It is home to a cave, like many other faces in stone throughout the world.
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:Parque Natural Municipal Pedra do Segredo
Custodian:Yasser Rabello (The Alchemist)
Country:Brazil

points.name: Haʻamonga ʻa Maui
points.description:
Haʻamonga ʻa Maui ("The Burden of Maui") is a stone trilithon located in Tonga, on the eastern part of the island of Tongatapu. It was built in the 13th century by King Tuʻitātui in honor of his two sons. The monument is sometimes called the "Stonehenge of the Pacific".
Type:Stone
Subtype:Artificial
Wikipedia:Haʻamonga ʻa Maui
Custodian:www.leylines.net
